Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired reddish); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The modern inscription 'DIOSK' is scratched on the interior surface of the foot. 'A foot sherd' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The size of the sherd indicates that it came from a very large chalice. The number '353' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Heavy chalices and chalice kraters are found in the Chian Animal Chalice Style and Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 839, pl. XXII, no. 839)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 691, no. 488)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1615) (phase 2)
